quote-text: While working, I suddenly heard a noise and looked up to find Robert Hughes, the art critic of Time magazine, staring at me in disbelief. âBut youâre Philip Glass! What are you doing here?â It was obvious that I was installing his dishwasher and I told him I would soon be finished. âBut you are an artist,â he protested. I explained that I was an artist but that I was sometimes a plumber as well and that he should go away and let me finish.
quote-source:
Philip Glass, who continued to work as both a plumber and a taxi driver until his late 40s (via saint-jerome)
